column4: I am trying to copy a folder from to some other folder but it say permission denied
anybody?
to what other folder ?
check folder owner please
the folder to be copied or destination folder?
both
folder -to- be- copied is owned by root , while the destination folder is by normal user
ok -- can you set original folder owner to yourself?
yes, what jrib said would be helpful. copying root folder to /home/ isn't a normal thing to happen.
both user accounts are mine
what application are you trying to install? firefox should be in the Ubuntu repositotues, so it installs automatically. it doesn't ask default destination then
how did you use sudo su? what part of this was done as root ?
any error message when you try that?
as normal user , while extracting it says cannot delete old files .....
did you try to extract to a different directory?
got it
:) now you can use su to delete old files ;)
going to compile firefox, are you? I get it's firefox and eclipse stuff
its java project
hmm, have fun :) (they tend to use 'sudo {command here}' rather than switching to root...) just ask if you have more questions.
thanks for the tip

i personally don't change that, because i can see which of the admins did what -- rather than seeing all the stuff as done by 'root' -- but there might be few other cons and pros that I didn't consider
